meanings.definition: A model representing a scene with three-dimensional figures, either in miniature or as a large-scale museum exhibit.
meanings.sent1: The school project involved creating tiny dioramas of different habitats.
meanings.sent2: The museum had an impressive collection of historical dioramas.
meanings.sent3: The dioramas at the science fair made the audience chuckle with their detailed animal scenes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast diorama of memories, each one carefully crafted and displayed.
meanings.sent5: The artist's dioramas were so lifelike that visitors felt like they had stepped into another world.

meanings.definition: A scene or event depicted in a diorama.
meanings.sent1: The dioramas in the exhibit showcased different moments in history.
meanings.sent2: The dioramas at the zoo depicted various animal habitats.
meanings.sent3: The dioramas at the school play added a touch of whimsy to the performance.
meanings.sent4: His words painted a diorama of emotions that she could vividly picture.
meanings.sent5: The dioramas of underwater life were so detailed that they seemed to come alive before your eyes.
